articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko, Tom Balmforth, Max Hunder
articles.description: Ukraine fired a volley of British Storm Shadow cruise missiles into Russia on Wednesday, the latest new Western weapon it has been permitted to use on Russian targets a day after it fired U.S. ATACMS missiles.
articles.title: Ukraine launches UK cruise missiles into Russia, a day after using US ATACMS

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Hamas' acting Gaza chief Khalil al-Hayya said in remarks broadcast on Wednesday that there would be no hostages-for-prisoners swap deal with Israel unless the war in the Palestinian enclave ended.
articles.title: Hamas: No hostages-for-prisoners swap deal with Israel unless Gaza war ends

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces killed at least 48 Palestinians in the Gaza Strip on Wednesday, including a rescue worker, health officials said, as troops deepened an incursion along the territory's northern edge, bombarding a hospital and blowing up homes.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill 48 people in Gaza, hospital in north makes distress call

articles.author: Thomas Escritt, Sarah Marsh
articles.description: Angela Merkel sought advice from the pope on dealing with Donald Trump when he was first elected U.S. president, hoping to find ways of convincing a man she saw as having a property developer's winner-or-loser mentality not to quit the Paris climate accords.
articles.title: Angela Merkel, in memoir, recalls tricks for dealing with Donald Trump

articles.author: David Brunnstrom, Simon Lewis
articles.description: The United States will veto a U.N. Security Council resolution for a ceasefire in Israel's war in Gaza if it is brought to a vote in its current form, a senior U.S. official said on Wednesday, accusing council members of cynically rejecting attempts at reaching a compromise.
articles.title: US will veto UN Security Council resolution on Gaza war in its current form, says official

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: The U.S. Senate on Wednesday blocked legislation that would have halted the sale of some U.S. weapons to Israel, which had been introduced out of concern about the human rights catastrophe faced by Palestinians in Gaza.
articles.title: US Senate blocks bid to halt some Israel military sales

articles.author: Renju Jose
articles.description: Australia's centre-left government on Thursday introduced a bill in parliament that aims to ban social media for children under 16 and proposed fines of up to A$49.5 million ($32 million) for social media platforms for systemic breaches.
articles.title: Australia launches 'landmark' bill to ban social media for children under 16

articles.author: Diego Oré
articles.description: Mexico's lower house of Congress on Wednesday approved a reform to abolish most of the country's autonomous bodies that regulate some economic sectors and ensure government transparency, a measure that could deepen tensions with the U.S. and risk potential credit rating downgrades.
articles.title: Mexico's lower house votes to abolish autonomous bodies

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskiy acknowledged the Crimea peninsula, seized by Russia in 2014, would have to be restored to Ukrainian sovereignty through diplomacy.
articles.title: Zelenskiy says Crimea can only be restored to Ukraine through diplomacy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A 42-year-old father of five faces a public caning at a mosque in Malaysia after being convicted of the Islamic crime of 'khalwat', or close proximity between unmarried couples, for the third time, a state official and media reports said.
articles.title: Malaysian man to be publicly caned at mosque for Islamic crime of close proximity
